title: Luxury UI polish: cinematic hero, refined navbar depth/spacing, elevated cards, consistent button hovers, premium font pairing

requirements.summary: Update Home hero image to a darker cinematic asset and add a soft black gradient overlay for a luxury feel while keeping CTA/text readable.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero image asset is updated to a darker, cinematic image (used as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated).
A soft black gradient overlay is visibly applied over the hero image without reducing text/CTA readability.
No backend image serving is introduced; the hero image is referenced directly from the Home page.

file_operations.description: Add the new darker cinematic hero background image asset at this exact path and filename so HomePage can reference it directly as a static asset.

Replace the hero image reference with frontend/public/assets/generated/storiespk-hero-cinematic-dark.dim_1600x600.png and add a soft black gradient overlay layer (e.g., absolute overlay within the image wrapper or hero section) to achieve a cinematic luxury look without harming text/CTA readability.

requirements.summary: Refine the sticky navbar with roomier padding, increased desktop item spacing, and a subtle drop shadow while preserving existing nav behavior on desktop and mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: Desktop navbar menu items have noticeably increased spacing compared to current styling, without wrapping/truncation on common viewport widths.
Header container padding is increased (or otherwise feels roomier) while keeping layout aligned within the existing max width container.
A subtle shadow appears under the navbar when viewed against page content, and the navbar remains sticky and functional on scroll.
Mobile menu open/close behavior and navigation actions remain unchanged.

file_operations.description: Adjust Tailwind classes to increase the header container padding and horizontal spacing between desktop nav items (and the auth button group), and add a subtle shadow to the sticky header container while keeping the existing navigation structure and mobile menu toggle behavior unchanged.

requirements.summary: Enhance story cards with stronger soft shadows and smooth hover lift/scale interactions across StoryCard and LuxuryFeaturedStoryCard without layout shifts.
acceptanceCriteria: Cards in the Stories listing (StoryCard) have a stronger soft shadow than before, without looking harsh or overly dark.
Cards in the Stories listing show a smooth hover effect (lift and/or slight scale) with an appropriate transition duration/easing.
Home page featured story cards (LuxuryFeaturedStoryCard) maintain the luxury look and also reflect the improved depth/hover interaction (consistent feel across card types).
Hover interaction does not cause layout shift that breaks the grid (no jumping content).

file_operations.description: Update the Card className to use a stronger-but-soft base shadow and add a smooth hover interaction (subtle translate/scale) with transition duration/easing; ensure transforms don’t cause grid layout shift (use transform-based effects, not margin/padding changes).

Align the featured card’s depth and hover interaction with StoryCard (slightly stronger soft shadow + smooth hover lift/scale with consistent transition), while preserving the existing luxury styling, readability, and content layout.

requirements.summary: Standardize site-wide button hover interactions with smooth 0.3s transitions and consistent luxury-themed hover/focus styling without editing read-only shadcn/ui source files.
acceptanceCriteria: All buttons across pages have a consistent 0.3s hover transition (at minimum covering background/border/text color; include transform where applicable).
Button border radius is consistent across variants and matches the global radius token already used by the theme.
Buttons that are meant to be solid black (e.g., primary CTAs on the Home page) remain solid black with white text and have refined hover/focus states consistent with a luxury theme.
No edits are made directly inside read-only UI component source files under frontend/src/components/ui; changes are achieved via composition, styling, or global CSS/theme tokens.

file_operations.description: Update global base styles so buttons (and button-like interactive elements) consistently use a 0.3s transition for hover/focus (e.g., duration-300 and appropriate transition properties), without modifying any files under frontend/src/components/ui.

requirements.summary: Apply a premium editorial font pairing site-wide: serif for headings and clean sans-serif for body text, loaded reliably in the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Headings (h1–h6 and heading-styled components) render with the selected serif font across the site.
Body text renders with the selected sans-serif font across the site.
Fonts are loaded correctly in the app (no fallback-only rendering in typical browsers).
Typography remains readable on mobile and desktop, and existing page layouts do not break due to font changes.

file_operations.description: Load the chosen fonts (Playfair Display for headings and Inter for body) via appropriate font link tags so typical browsers download the fonts reliably at runtime.
Apply the font pairing globally (e.g., body uses the sans font family; h1–h6 use the serif font family) to ensure consistent typography across all pages without requiring per-page changes.
